Review Text: Creepy good!  I can't watch movies in which an animal dies but this dark stuff is my cup of tea!  Well written script.  Acting is really good.  Story line is diabolically good!  They put in just the right hooks to keep me watching!
Review Title: Good eats!
Rating: 5.0

reference_summary:
American Hustle
Drama, Strange, Fun, Serious
['From the director of Silver Linings Playbook and The Fighter, AMERICAN HUSTLE is outrageously entertaining and one of the most acclaimed films of the year.']
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Russell'], 'Producers': ['Charles Roven', 'Richard Suckle', 'Megan Ellison', 'Jonathan Gordon'], 'Starring': ['Christian Bale', 'Bradley Cooper', 'Amy Adams']}
I didn't like it.....it was a great story and could have  been intense and exciting.  Instead, it was hokey.  Just not my cup of tea.
Hokey
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English'], 'Directors': ['Stephen Gyllenhaal', 'Billy Gierhart', 'Ray McKinnon', 'Nicole Kassell', 'Jim McKay', 'Scott Teems', 'Keith Gordon', 'Romeo Tirone', 'Andrew Bernstein', 'Dennie Gordon'], 'Producers': ['Mark Johnson', 'Melissa Bernstein', 'Ray McKinnon'], 'Studio': ['Sundance', 'AMC Plus Drama']}
One of the most compelling dramas I've ever seen on tv.  The study of a man who has been in prison for 20 yrs. and then tries to readjust to "normalcy" outside the confines of the prison, is in-depth, smart, and compelling - sorry for the use of that adjective again.
smart, and compelling - sorry for the use of ...

Like the character, the writing, the story.....really fun.
Four Stars
I AM
Tom Shadyac  (Actor, Director),     Thom Hartmann  (Actor)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Documentary
['Product Description', 'I AM is the story of a successful Hollywood director, Tom Shadyac (LIAR LIAR, NUTTY PROFESSOR, BRUCE ALMIGHTY), who experienced a life threatening head injury, and his ensuing journey to try and answer two very basic questions:  What s wrong with our world? and What can we do about it? With a film crew of four, Tom visits some of today s great minds, including authors, poets, teachers, religious leaders, and scientists (Howard Zinn, Lynn McTaggart, Desmond Tutu, Thom Harmann, Coleman Barks) searching for the fundamental endemic problem that causes all of the other problems, while simultaneously reflecting on this own life choices of excess, greed and eventual healing. We started by asking what s wrong wit the world, and ended up discovering what s right with it. Tom Shadyac', 'Review', "'Amazing...' --Ellen DegeneresEveryone needs to see this film! --Bruce Cohen, Academy Award Winning Producer (American Beauty)Entertaining and enlightening. The I AM Documentary is a spark of light and a work of love. --Marianne Williamson, New York Times Best Seller"]

{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Rodrigo García', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Jack Bender', 'Tim Hunter', 'John Patterson', 'Scott Winant', 'Alison Maclean', 'Peter Medak', 'Todd Field', 'Tucker Gates'], 'Producers': ['Howard Klein', 'Daniel Knauf', 'Bernie Caulfield'], 'Starring': ['Nick Stahl', 'Clancy Brown', 'Amy Madigan'], 'Studio': ['HBO']}
I have 2 more episodes to watch and don't want it to end.  I have enjoyed both seasons - kind of Fellini-esque but compelling!  My only criticism is that once you've seen the boobs, we've seen enough.  And there's one scene in Season 1 of full exposure of the strippers genitals and, ya know, enough is enough.  We all have good imaginations.
Great but greater without the boobs!

profile:
**User Summary:**

- **General Preference:** The user engages with films and series centered on serious narratives and complex human experiences, valuing uplifting themes intertwined with serious storytelling. Their latest interaction reflects a deep appreciation for well-crafted, engaging content that evokes strong emotional responses.

- **Critique Style:** They maintain a discerning critical eye, appreciating unique interpretations of classic themes. The user values artistic innovation and diverse storytelling perspectives that resonate emotionally, while displaying sensitivity towards explicit content. They prefer narratives that imply rather than display, enhancing the viewing experience without overindulgence.

- **Rating Trends:** The user predominantly rates works around 4.0, with a recent 5.0 rating indicating their capacity for high engagement. Their average rating has increased to 4.6, signifying a strong appreciation for exceptional storytelling that balances serious topics with uplifting messages.

- **Categories of Interest:** Their interests remain rooted in documentaries and dramas with profound depth. They are particularly drawn to narratives that creatively fuse serious topics with positivity and inspiration.

- **Film and Series Expectations:** Actively seeking intelligent and thought-provoking content, the user emphasizes innovative narratives that maintain emotional connections. Their latest feedback highlights a preference for enriching viewing experiences that handle sensitive subjects thoughtfully while promoting positive outcomes.

Overall, the user values emotionally resonant storytelling, consistently upholding high standards and seeking narratives that skillfully blend depth with uplifting conclusions.
